case_vignette: A 56-year-old woman, gravida 3, para 3, comes to the physician because her left breast has become larger, hot, and itchy over the past 2 months. The patient felt a small lump in her left breast 1 year ago but did not seek medical attention at that time. She has hypertension and hyperlipidemia. Menarche was at the age of 11 years and menopause at the age of 46 years. Her mother died of breast cancer at the age of 45 years. The patient does not smoke or drink alcohol. Current medications include labetalol, simvastatin, and daily low-dose aspirin. She is 170 cm (5 ft 7 in) tall and weighs 78 kg (172 lb); BMI is 27 kg/m2. Her temperature is 37.7°C (99.9°F), pulse is 78/min, and blood pressure is 138/88 mm Hg. Examination shows large dense breasts. There is widespread erythema and edematous skin plaques over a breast mass in the left breast. The left breast is tender to touch and left-sided axillary lymphadenopathy is noted.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My left breast has become larger, hot, and itchy over the past 2 months.
Have you noticed any skin changes, such as redness or dimpling?
There's widespread redness and swollen patches of skin over the mass in my left breast.
Have you experienced any nipple discharge or changes in the nipple area?
No, I haven't experienced any nipple discharge or changes in the nipple area.
Do you have any personal or family history of breast cancer?
My mother died of breast cancer at the age of 45.
Have you experienced any unexplained weight loss, fevers, or night sweats?
No, I haven't experienced any unexplained weight loss, fevers, or night sweats.
Have you observed any swollen lymph nodes in your armpit or around your collarbone?
Yes, I have swollen lymph nodes in the armpit on my left side.
What is your age and are you currently on any medications?
I am 56 years old and currently taking labetalol, simvastatin, and daily low-dose aspirin.
Based on your age, symptoms, family history, and lack of systemic symptoms, have you previously had any breast imaging or biopsies performed?
I felt a lump in my breast a year ago but I didn't see a doctor or get any breast imaging or biopsies done.

It is critical to evaluate you with breast imaging as soon as possible. Due to the persistent and progressive symptoms of unilateral breast enlargement, redness, warmth, itchiness, and associated lymphadenopathy with a family history of breast cancer, my concern is high for an advanced breast malignancy.

**Final Diagnosis:** Suspected inflammatory breast cancer.
